intro: Senecio nemiae, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has hairy, silver-green leaves that help reduce water loss, and its growth habit is often low and spreading. Senecio nemiae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
